Game of Thrones is an exceptionally popular and critically-acclaimed show. If you're considering purchasing season 3 I have to assume you know about the show so I'm not going to go into those details. I'm primarily going to focus on the Bluray release itself.

The third season of Game of Thrones is packaged almost identically to the previous bluray releases. Five bluray discs are interspersed throughout folding case that fits within a hard slipcase. A plastic slipcover goes over these to create the dragon shadow effect. A smaller slip case that fits within the hard slipcover holds the double-sided DVD versions of the show as well as the digital copy code. In terms of packaging it is frankly exquisite. The only comments I want to make with regards to this are:

1. I consider having the DVDs included as kind of a bonus, but the double sided nature of the discs as well as the slip case you store them in creates a perfect storm to scratch or damage the DVDs. Handle them with care.

2. The DVD release is 5 discs, the bluray release is also 5 discs. With bluray discs able to hold so much more information I'm kind of at a loss as to why so many discs are needed. I wish it were fewer discs so that they wouldn't have to be changed as frequently as the DVDs do.

3. As I stated previously, the packaging is gorgeous, but it's also a little bulky. I wish it were a little slimmer so it took up a little less space but the seasons do look pretty awesome on my media rack.

4. The digital copy is an amazing feature to this collection. Note: it can doesn't just have to be redeemed on iTunes, it can also be redeemed on Ultraviolet services too such as Vudu.
The DVD arrived early if not on time (before season 1 & 2). If you are a GOT fan, you will not be disappointed.

Blu-ray, DVD, digital combo packs are becoming commonplace and I for one think it's fantastic. This is a lovely edition to any movie collection  and looks fantastic on the shelf. As with the first and second seasons- the packaging fits theme and is well designed for style and function. Blu-ray is the perfect format to showcase the incredible work and attention to detail that has been invested in the series by all involved in the production. I haven't yet utilized my digital copy, but the compact and simple way the DVD version is packaged in it's own slip-case provides great portability but also protection for the disks. I've found myself much more amendable to the idea of loaning out a season to a friend since I don't have to part with my precious Blu-ray boxed set. I wouldn't pay $75-$80 for this- or for any boxed set honestly- but for the $35 I spent it was a no-brainer.

This thing goes on sale for under $40 like every other week, so don't pay more than that.

That being said $40 for the BulRays, DVDs AND Digital Copies of ANYTHING is great, never mind an entire season of the best show currently on television!!

HBO has killed this story by adding elements to the screen that simply weren't part of the books.  Face it world.  Women are treated extremely poorly in Game of Thrones.  It is no excuse to say that everyone is treated poorly in Game of Thrones.  It really isn't.

Queen Cersi's rape by her brother is a case in point.  It didn't happen in the book because he wasn't there at that time.  There was no need for it, artistically speaking.  The moment, understandably, upset plenty of fans of the show and books, for which Martin apologized: "The scene was always intended to be disturbing," he wrote, "but I do regret if it has disturbed people for the wrong reasons."

Wrong reasons?????  He obviously believes that there are right reasons for rape to be portrayed on the TV????

Game of Thrones could have been something great.  Instead, HBO has simply ruined it.  Game of Thrones is misogynist and gynophobic at best.  It really shows where HBO's heads are at.

Well poor decisions come home to roost and how! There are some major developments in season three and a whole host of exciting things are set up for season four. There are things that happen in this series that are just jawdropping! The huge number of characters allow a lot of scope to surprise the audience with who gets killed off and who rises to the occasion. Personally I am less interested in what happens north of the wall and that element put me off reading beyond the first book. Fortunately, the bulk of the stories here are concerned with the more gritty dealings between the contenders for the throne. Being unfamiliar with the books, means that virtually everything in the TV series is new to me  confrontingly so at times. It continues to be a superbly produced show. Things look as they should, whether its a grand castle vista or a brutal killing. The violence is very strong but that is the key to this show. Mistakes and losing a fight are punished ruthlessly, some things really make you shudder. The stakes are as high as they can get. It is heart-in-your-mouth TV at its best!

I've barely kept track of all the characters and families. That said, I've become thoroughly engrossed in this series. And Season 3 is probably the best season yet. The richness of the world portrayed in the first two seasons allows the story to expand in multiple directions, with a pay-off that no two-hour movie could match. You don't have to love dragons and magic to become enamored of this TV show. If you appreciate great stories, multi-dimensional characters, timeless (and modern) themes, and superb acting, you will most likely enjoy this show.

You care about these characters, even the ones you love to hate (do you hear that, Joffrey?), and that only enhances the excitement and anticipation of what happens next.  There is a huge surprise in this season, and it doesn't come at the end of the final episode, so be careful as you watch because you will be caught off-guard and you WILL want to see it again.  The clarity of the pictures and the quality of the sound are exemplary throughout the season, and the special effects are dazzling; you will be amazed.  There is nothing here that I didn't like, and this season deserves six stars if only Amazon would allow that many.  Stop reading and click 'add to cart.'  You won't be disappointed, either..

HBO SHOULD develop a new theme  something along the lines of Nobody does it better. Because no other network excels at producing epic stories or high-definition releases like this cable network. We previewed its potential with series like Rome and Deadwood, but Game of Thrones consistently sets standards others don't come close to.

Episode One opens with Davos Seaworth (Liam Cunningham), a survivor of Season Twos Battle of Kings Landing, stranded on a barren rock. Blistered and ragged, we can know hes been there some time. As he waves for help from a distant ship, nothing could look more realistic  unless it was possible to step into the scene ourselves like the legendary Holodeck of Star Trek: The Next Generation.

That scene  and all the rest of the dynamic third season  look and sound so authentic on this 1080p and DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 surround track, the only thing better is being there ...

Except Westeros isn't the healthiest world to visit. Even those who have never seen the series or read author/executive producer George R.R. Martins A Song of Fire and Ice, know about the Red Wedding. Its a scene from episode 9, The Rains of Castamere, and has become a classic TV moment. (I was one of the readers wondering if the Red Wedding and its aftermath would make it to film. It actually surpassed my expectations.)

The general plot isn't as complicated as youd think. Everything revolves around a bitter civil war over who will sit on the Iron Throne and rule the previously united Seven Kingdoms. This fantasy medieval world has known a long period of prosperity, but corruption and a sadistic young king have the realm engaging in full-out carnage, betrayal, espionage, torture and assassination. Game of Thrones appeal comes in the fully realized characters and their actions; we need to know what will happen next.

All this is thanks to series co-creators, David Benioff and D.B. Weiss, who fell in love with Martins books. Their attention to detail, staying true to the source material, writing, directing and casting has turned the show into a masterwork. Although it never would've happened without a network willing to take a millions-of-dollars risk to put it on air. Theres now talk of making a film for theatrical release.

Major kudos also go to HBO for the terrific batch of bonus features provided on the Blu-ray/DVD/Digital package. There are hours of extras loaded on the five Blu-ray discs. Every episode has an in-episode guide, allowing viewers to access background characters, location and historical info. All episodes, except the first, have a commentary and, in some cases, two. Speakers include actors, writers and directors. Some rely on fun, such Kissed by Fire, with Nikolaj Coster Waldau (Jaime Lannister), Gwendoline Christie (Brienne of Tarth) and writer Bryan Cogman. Others are more serious and informative, such as The Bear and the Maiden Fair with Martin and director Michelle MacLaren.

My favorite was The Rains of Castamere with Richard Madden (Robb Stark), Michelle Fairley (Catelyn Stark) and director David Nutter. Nutter talks about a website with more than 9-million hits on the episode. Fairley had never seen it before, saying she was too scared to watch it. Both Fairley and Madden are weeping by the end.

Other bonus features include a more detailed look at Rains, and short featurettes: A Gathering Storm, recapping Season 2; New Characters; The Politics of Marriage, and Inside the Wildings, a closer look at the Northerners being chased south by the White Walkers  another mainland conflict-to-be, I reckon. Also find a handful of outstanding deleted and extended scenes, the best featuring Tywin Lannister (Charles Dance).

I missed the Round Table discussions with Benioff, Weiss, and the actors as found on the Season 1 and 2 presentations, but its easy to see how they were kind of busy. (Exhausted and injured, too. Kit Harrington (Jon Snow) broke his ankle; many of his running scenes were played by a body double; some were rewritten so he could sit.)

Maybe theyll be able to catch their breath for by the time Season 4 comes out on disc - but I doubt it.   Kay Reynolds

I got into this whole series on accident...I had every intention of watching it to be able to make fun of it and now, I'm hooked...but don't exactly know WHY!!! My favorite character got killed off in Season 1 along with another one that I was beginning to warm up to. Season 2 draws you back into the lives of the characters and you either love them more or loathe their [fictional] existence more than one thought possible..for fictional characters of course (I have to remind myself of that). Season 3 is good, but truly a mental and emotional roller-coaster. I found myself conflicted about the treatment of one character who, at first, I thought deserves the treatment he's getting and by the end he's the one person (besides Joffrey, for obvious reasons) I WANT to die just so he can be put out of his misery. This season steps up the development and personality of characters a dozen notches. I won't give away the ending, but I will say that as good as this season was, because of how it ended I was not as eager to watch the next season...I felt deflated and defeated by the end...and all I did was sit and watch!

if by now you aren't on board the GoT train, then you have a lot of catching up to do.  But a thirty hour marathon of watching this show now is really a bit much.... I advise a season a day with a nice break in between.  However, it's terribly addictive, and the onslaught continues in terms of sex, violence, power struggles and so on.  Hell, even the costumes rock.

HBO never backs down from portraying borderline questionable themes and scenes with a gritty reality that will make you sit up and gasp at a few of the scenes.  It's got its hooks in me like crystal meth.... can't stop this thing we've started....

Deviation from the books continues but is always done both with GRRM's awareness and involvement.  He's got a close relationship with the writers and they are keeping true to the TONE and FLAVOUR of the books even where they make changes to the action or timeline.  Ultimately the result still serves to bring you forward right where you're supposed to be.

At this point I've stopped reading the books looking for explanations of things and I am taking the series at face value.  It's that good.  When I go back to the books again later they will dovetail with the show much more logically I am sure.

There is a new packaging design for the third season, it still matches but it's got this translucent plastic slipcase instead of the cardboard one.  My OCD wishes it matched identically, but hey.... as long as it's not a big difference I'll be ok.

Same 5 discs with 10 episodes as prior seasons.  Still putting fun features on each disc instead of a features disc separately.

If you're reading my review, you want to be convinced to buy it.  So go buy it already.  You won't be sorry.  The only reason not to get DVD is if you get Blu-Ray.  Otherwise it's a gem.  I just wish I could buy season four already.... the wait is gonna kill me.....

Let me begin by saying that I absolutely love this show...it's hands down probably one of my favorites. In fact I love it so much that I even pre-ordered season 3 the second I was able...and I got the dvd set finally in about err...feb?

Well because my life as a student was hectic and busy at the time the dvd set was left unopened and still sealed on my shelf, so I finally open it a couple of months later...tonight basically (and way past the return policy deadline might I add...yes I know it's my own stupid fault for not checking but still...) So, I open it to check out my dvds and my dvd sets packaging design and I'm literally like WTF...there's seriously a disc missing...DISC 4 IS MISSING!!! JUST GONE!!!! AND I JUST OPENED IT!!! IT WAS SERIOUSLY SEALED 2 MINS AGO!!!! I've never EVER EVER had a problem pre-ordering this series or anything from Amazon before in my life (and trust me I order and pre-order a lot of crap off here lol) but this...this is absolutely ridiculous...I'm incredibly disappointed at Amazon, HBO, or whoever is in charge of shipping these dvds out...it's an absolute joke Amazon! A joke! YOU OUGHT TO BE ASHAMED! My only wish was of course that I had checked the dvds right when I first got them...whelp guess that's what I get for putting my trust in Amazon who I thought was a company who would never let me down...I mean it just sucks cause when you purchase something you just automatically assume...especially if you have pre-ordered it to get what you've paid for...obviously this is not the case here!

My only suggestion is BUYER BEWARE!!! And don't make the same mistake I did...always check to make sure what you paid for is actually in the box. -.-"

(Also, as a side note after this I am never ever pre-ordering dvd's or anything from this site again...sorry Amazon you've totally lost my trust here...because quite frankly a missing disc is kind of a big deal...and not to mention complete BS!!! I'd be better off pre-ordering elsewhere or from some offline store...)

Fantastic! Pure addictive entertainment!  Having the entire season available in a one stop shop is really convenient, and the Blu-Ray brings you right into the set.  Superb quality picture and sound.  A must have, if you appreciate "The Game of Thrones"..;~)
Arrived very quickly, mint quality, fantastic show. The digital downloads actually work with Itunes for once, which is a wonderful perk.

It is as addictive as the first and second season! Definitely worth the price we paid. Excellent show. You will love to hate some characters, Love, love, love other characters and constantly be shocked by who dies.

They continue to impress me with the locations, sets and costumes. The actors have given life to the charecters in the books that reading did not do. I am loving this show! FABULOUS!!! I have marathon warched 1-3 seasons and am now dreaming about the characters.........
This show is AWESOME. Best show I have ever seen. If you haven't read the books or seen the show, I recommend both.

Great series fast delivery and good service. Never disappointed with the story line can't wait for next season and will be waiting for the release.
I always look forward to the next release. It is a very addictive series. Great sets and acting. Characters development is much better than most cable series.

The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because of the box, I don't care if it's plastic, I was expecting that, but the white box, without any logos, or anything for that matter just didn't do it for me. Boxes should look like The Dark Knight series, which were made clear for collectibles. But other than this, I'm pretty pleased with my purchase. The dragon could have had a bit more detail though.

I was way behind on GoT, I watched season 2 and 3 back to back.  I had heard a little spoiler about the end of the season but much to my surprise it still caught me off guard.  I like a series where "noone is safe", something you don't get in a "normal" TV series (No matter what peril Kirk is in, Spock or Scotty are gonna save him to be in the next episode!  Kirk in GoT?  Dead in 3 episodes by a rabid dire-wolf bite.)
Can't wait for next season. Am looking to the upcoming to start soon. This is a wonderfully epic series. I suggest buying seasons 1 and 2 as well.
HBO continues its commitment to well written, well directed and superb acting.  I actually bought HBO to watch season 4.
I love the show! I only have a plain old DVD player but this combo pack had both DVD and Blu-ray. I didn't touch 2/3 of the discs because I only needed the DVD version.
This series locks you in and will not let you go. You route for the good guy, but the bad guy always seems to win. You end up maybe next season. You can't stop.

Good story, even better characters played by even greater actors and actresses.

Oh there is some blood, well yeah there is quite a bit of blood, so if you don't like sprays of crimson, don't even consider this show.
Well written and the costumes are fantastic. Keeps you coming back for more. I could watch this for hours on end.
Great Movie!!!  My whole extended family can't wait for the movies to come out. We all love them! Hurry season 4.
The story great of course. The product is excellent.  I would recomend highly. Having a digital copy is a bonus.

From the writing to the music to the acting, HBO truely lives up to the high standards set by the book, and the only problem they have is that they can't produce them fast enough, eagerly awaiting to watch seasons four, five, and six!

The DVD arrived on time and in great condition. I won't go into the quality of the show, as Amazon really has nothing to do with that, but the availability of the DVDs and the speed with which it was shipped was excellent.

Love the storyline.  The acting and cinematics are epic.
I have never seen a series that goes to this extent and expense
but, it shows in the quality of the series.

I read all the books and decided to watch the series. This is one of the best adaptations from book to screen that I have watched. I have no complaints and thoroughly enjoy this show. The biggest issue I had was some of the cast did not match with what I had envisioned while reading. An excellent, entertaining show. If you love Sci-fi or period pieces with a lot of action and clever characters you will love this!
Everything was perfect!!! I love this show!!! Now I can watch it everyday if I want. And Amazon has the best prices!!!
This is the best show on TV.  Start with season 1 and by the time you get to this season you will be hooked.
will continue to watch the series and will wait for the other episodes to catch up on whats happening. nice.

It is easy to just simply watch the entire thing one sitting. If the episodes were not not so long, I would do this all the time. This series is interesting and full of surprises, your favorite heroes and villains may turn on you or disappear at the drop of a hat. This really is the best show on television today. It's all that I would expect of fire and blood.
Two episodes per disk, nice box, set up well in that you can select play all and run through the special features.

Game of Thrones is a great series and I just had to buy the blu-ray, dvd, digital copy combo. Getting all three versions makes the price very reasonable. The extra features on the blu-ray also do a lot to help explain the story and the characters.
This is probably the best season thus far, and the bonus features are great as always. Some of the best audio commentaries I've ever heard.
Epic just like the first two seasons and the best additional content. Can't wait to see what else this amazing series has to hold and can't wait for the next book.
enjoyed it very much although it was a little bloodier than usual.  Can't wait for season four.  Hope this season has more of the dragons.
Great season! Can't wait for the next one to start!! DVDs were clean and worked great! I Love this show.

I had to return this DVD set because I received one as a gift right before this one arrived. It appeared to be in good condition and did arrive timely.

Having read the books , was not dissapointed with Season 3. Still really enjoy the introduction of minor characters,  little different from main lines but a really good layout .Seeing the other side of the Wall has been well done....
Can't stop watching this series and reading the books and thinking about GoT Fire and Ice, epic themes, other worlds, great escape!

Can't wait for season 4.  Best entertainment of the year, certainly the equal of Gravity.  Although interviews in the newspapers of 3 of it main actors say they have not read the books.  The cast makes the presentation seem natural and complete as if the story were live.  Great display of professional talent.
Loved it, not disappointed. It captured the brutality of the wedding scene perfectly. Can't wait for the next season. Bring it on.
This show keeps getting better and better. Each season has managed to out do the last, can't wait till season 4

This is the greatest season of any show I have ever seen.

I am not one to buy DVD's, but I absolutely had to.

Not only is this show fantastic, having them on hand is great. I've loaned them out to multiple friends and every one of them have bought copies of their own after watching.

And if you've never watched the show. . . .you need to GET ON THAT!
Best show on tv plus all the extra features and quality of video. Always buy Blu-Ray. Love this purchase and will be buying the next season when it comes out on Blu-ray.

We don't get the channel that carries "Game of Thrones". I had tried to read the first book, but got so confused. We bought the first season, got hooked after the first episode, and ordered season two. Watched season two and waited impatiently for the third season. It was the best so far! The dvds are clear, sharp, and wonderful to watch. Now get to work on getting season four on dvd before someone spoils it for me!
Or I've gotten that way. I'm a late comer to the series, but it really is a lot better than I expected and totally worth all the hype over it. Can't wait for the next season, and the next....
Really, what more need be said!? If you're a fan (or want to be), or just trying to catch up, get this DVD!
It's Game of Thrones guys....I just wish the Author would hurry up and finish the books!  The suspense is killing me!
I watched the first 2 seasons in about 36 hours!  Very good acting and story line! Almost want to purchase HBO, almost!

I became a fan of Game of Thrones after seeing season 1. I've read all the books and enjoy watching the dvds because it helps bring the characters in this amazing series to life.  If you've read the books you will really enjoy the mini series.
Very addicting.  I am still in shock of the Starks. However, I wanna see the GOOD GODS win in season 4!!!!
One of the best adaptions of screenplay from incredible book series...it will have you hooked from first episode and you're likely to binge watch one season after the other...

I am a big fan of great fantasy writing.  Tolkein was the best.  Peter Jackson richly deserved the academy awards for best director and best picture that he won for The Return of the King.  Since Tolkein, only Robert Jordan and George R.R. Martin approached his creative genius.  However they could not complete their stories and just got caught up in logorrhea.  Jordan was silenced by death and Martin by a paralyzing case of writer's block  However the early books of both writers were amazing and showed great promise. Too bad the Wheel of Time and the Song or Fire and Ice sagas will never be completed by the original geniuses who created them.  The HBO adaptation of the first books of the Fire and Ice saga are great.  The actors are superb, and the director is doiing a monumental job..
So awesome, much win. Loved the books, love the series. Couldn't ask for more from the serial killers of feels everywhere.
action and adventure for us to see always on the move. I hope to buy the next season when it comes out to put the other three.

Fantasy on the scale and quality of The Lord or the Rings, with a good measure of intrigue, debauchery, gallantry, and surprisingly unexpected twists thrown in for good measure...I don't know who to root for...can't wait for season 4!!!  The quality of the sets and costumes and complexity of the story is a standard for the rest of Hollywood to strive for...I would give this series 10 stars if that was the top, Oh Hell, 11 stars then!!! You have to pay attention to every minute or you will miss something crucial.
I was blow. Away by the 3rd season. It left me in shock. I'm looking forward to the 4th season!!!
Game of Thrones is my favorite HBO series.  The third season was the best season.  I have season 1 & 2 so I will definitely buy the other seasons.

Martin, HBO, and Amazon..

First, let's address this is a rating on the show, and not HBO. If you don't have a cable TV subscription + $20 or more for HBO, their policy for us common people is F U. im a huge fan of the books and the show, I had to get season three to keep my collections up to date. the price was great! I am so glad I accidently ran across this series by renting it from the library for season 1. I prompty bought all 3 seasons on dvd and can't wait to get season 4. The scenery is fabulous. I usually have read the books before seeing movies. This time I am watching the movies first because they are so spectacular. I've started reading the books and am surprised that the movie does not disappoint (like it usually does leaving off important things - ie the Jurassic park movie, what a great book and the movie was disappointing to me with so much left off ).
You will love this series.

Intense, addictive, entertaining, and very interesting to follow.  One of the best series on HBO.  I can't wait for next season.
Incredible show and this season will blow your mind. Just get it, everyone else did. And get the other seasons too.

I have seen each of the first three seasons, and I felt that this one was definitely the best so far. I love the fact that no characters are safe in this show, the unpredictability, and the good writing for each of the myriad plot lines. Watching this actually made me consider getting HBO just to see Season 4 as soon as possible.

After buying the first two seasons of highly recommended Game, we wonder why we bothered, much less persisting with Season 3 trying to find reason for raves. Content should be x rated, speech is hard to understand, story line is confusing. Classic movies are much more entertaining.

My husband and I are huge fans of Game of Thrones and as we don't get the premium channels, we can't wait for the DVD's to come out.  The 3rd season was just as good as the first two.  Highly recommend it.

Continues to be the most surprising program on television. No character is safe from death apparently and while it makes me fear more for the remaining few I have come to love it gives me hope the ones I hate are going out eventually too.
  The writing is terrific and casting was wonderful, cant wait for the remaining seasons. Blu ray features and quality are top notch.
Exactly as advertised. Got here on time too. Very happy with the item. Will return again for the next season

WELL, WELL, WELL I don't even know where to start, OK let me start of by saying I'm not big on giving away a lot of details and storyline SO you're not going to see that here as I want everyone to enjoy the show for what it is and how I experienced it. I was turned on to this show by a friend and in turn I've turned about 10 people on to this show and I hope many more after this and other reviews, and trust me this is the one time you want to walk into a show blind because it will be surprise after surprise and the best past of this show is they kill off lead characters and this is what makes this show so great because this is how it happens in the real world and at the end of the day if more shows did this not just when someone wants off the show they would find that YES the viewers will be upset for awhile but in the end it makes it a better show. At the end of the day this is by far one of the best DRAMAS EVER!!!HBO you did this. The show has only one flaw and thats that stupid 10 episodes per season thing that the network is now doing, in the 90's they gave you about 18-20 shows per season then in the early 2000's that dropped to 14-16 then it went to 12 and now it's down to 10...stop being so greedy HBO!!! This is how you kill a great show!
These movies have great acting, along with excellent scripts, storytelling. really dynamic plot that constantly changes so you never know whats going to happen next.

I love this show and was looking forward to watching the third season but some of the discs came already damaged right out of the package. We are not able to play them at all. I wish these had been made with better quality - sounds like a lot of people have this problem. Extremely disappointed. Be careful when you purchase these.

The packaging is great! The sleeve over the box is awesome, the clear dragon is real cool. The white box has a great look, and the case for the discs is amazing with faces of the actors. Awesome, can't wait till the next one!!!  My wife even fell in love with it.  Lots of action and suspense.
Love love this series. Picked this show out of a hat and watched almost straight through. Let's just say I was tired for a few days.

Episode 4 of this season was amazing, and the next season of this show will be a great ending for readers of A Storm of Swords.  The events of this season were great aside from the Red Wedding, that is something I'll be fine with never seeing again.
Great acting cast, the story draws you in. The development of characters old and new is remarkable. Can not wait for the new season

I am totally in love with Game of Thrones; I read all five books and felt depressed when I finished the last one, nothing I read these days comes even close to this series. Maybe Diana Gabaldon and her Outlander series is a close second, who could not love the story of Jamie and Claire.

Who would have thought that a TV series could so capture the books, but it does to a T...........I am loving Season 3 as much as I did Season 1 and 2........I feel like I live in the story, I never want it to end..........thank you.

Excellent, can't wait for season 4, though I guess I will have to! It was all I was hoping it to be!

Wow! This season rocks! It's not just because they picked up the pace/action. They also fleshed out the characters by giving them back story and showing their motivations. My impression of the first season was, "All these people are despicable. Who cares what they do?" Not now! They have hearts, feelings, and are more like real people. Even if you don't like them, you can now understand them and see that they have the same feelings (in some ways) as you. The writers weren't afraid to cut, cut, cut. In a heartbeat, the story makes a quick turn and, like a rollercoaster, you are speeding off to the unknown. Where the ends is a far cry from where it started. Enjoy the ride. It's a killer!
Love this series and creative characters; I also love the fact that the writers aren't afraid to kill off central characters
What can I say?  I love this series and am currently refreshing my memory in preparation for the new season.
Thank goodness it arrived,my 80 year old mum has been waiting for season 3  to arrive,( we live in Australia) now we just have to keep her calm until season4.

Yes it did, it, more then met my expectation. I love the Game of thrones! Its very well done actresses and actors play their parts as if they had been turned back. The producers David Benioff and D.B.Weiss are doing a great keeping everyone on track and staying with the story line, that the author George R.R. Martin so wonderfully wrote. Its so wonderfully wrote and  enjoyable to watch. The director is going a great job putting the movie together. I can't wait for season 4.

Change the book version but is better watching the characters in the movie.

I can't get enough of this series.  My whole family is hooked and we watch entire seasons over a couple weekends.  Caution, the subject matter is for adults.

We enjoyed this enough to "binge watch " it from season 1 through this one. Having read the books previously, I was worried that the adaptaion to screen would exclude some details and scenes that I consider important to the overall story. I need not have worried about that. So I checked Amazon and saw that both seasons were available for $35 each and each boxed set includes both DVD and Blu Ray versions as well as digital copies so I bought them both in the spot. Waited only two days and then they were here. They are both nicely packaged and include maps of Westeros, as well as character's family trees and houses. They also come with nice durable sleeves that I am sure will stand up to time and handling. I would definitely recommend both sets to anyone who enjoys a good and exciting drama series and anyone who is a collector of the G.O.T. brand.

"Game of Thrones" is a fantasy series aired on HBO, based on George R. R. Martin's fantasy novels "A Song of Ice and Fire". The plot is set in the fictitious lands of Westeros and Essos, where a power struggle for the Iron Throne rages between different noble houses after the murder of the old king. This DVD contains the episodes of the third season, and is notable for the episode "The Rains of Castamere", in which several of the main characters are brutally slain, disregarding every conventional idea about how TV should be made. But then, we've seen it before...in "Lost".

I admit that I'm not an engaged super-fan of "Game of Thrones", but like most people, I nevertheless find myself watching every episode. Why? No idea, really. As I said in my review of Season Two, this is simply a remake of the European Early Middle Ages, with some Roman and "Oriental" spices thrown in. In contrast to most fantasy, Martin's story has very little supernatural flavour, and the whole plot feels just as meaningless as medieval history. We're talking blood feuds, civil wars, arranged marriages, orgies, strange new religions frequently even worse than the old ones... Europe around AD 600?

Ironically, it could be the incredibly complex plot (or rather parallel plots) which makes the trick. That, and the colourful characters, makes it difficult not to find *something* of interest. A bit like a Swedish smorgasbord, I suppose? And yes, many viewers love the nudity or pretend to abhor the violence...

Personally, I found the unapologetic, politically incorrect Orientalism of the Daenerys Targaryen subplot a real guilty pleasure. A blond, Nordic valkyrie liberating Black slaves and challenging effeminate and vile "Semites"... I'm surprised nobody started a culture war over this? Instead, people pretended to be upset when mad king Joffrey turned out to be a homophobe. LOL! Oh, and yes, the strange new religion of the Red Priestess is really an allegory for Christianity, not Zoroastrianism. But please don't tell anyone, because that could *really* start something...

I will probably watch the fourth season of "Game of Thrones", whenever Swedish public service TV sees fit to show it. Next year?

A Game of Thrones was a brilliant book with great characters, action, and excitement.  Season 1 of the show was equally brilliant.

A Clash of Kings started out slowly but crescendoed to an exhilarating climax.  Season 2 of the show followed a similar arch.

I'm mystified as to how A Storm of Swords, arguably the strongest source material yet, could produce television as dull and scattered as the first two-thirds of Season 3 of 'Game of Thrones'.

Similar to Season 2, which ended with a pair of highly focused and engaging episodes, Season 3 offers up a trio of incredibly strong shows to close things out.  The problem is the first 7 episodes which could have, and should have, been condensed down to 2 or 3.  It's not that "nothing happens," as has been argued by the shows critics and disputed by its sycophants, just that nothing compelling happens for the first 90% of each viewing.

Ask any fan of the show to recount for you the memorable moments which occur in Season 3 and you'll undoubtedly get responses similar to the following (no spoilers):

Locke helps Jaime remember (Episode 3, 50:25)
Craster mouths off to Mormont (Episode 4, 36:29)
Dany makes a deal (Episode 4, 46:40)
Littlefinger's monologue (Episode 6, 46:15)
Jaime turns back (Episode 7, 50:08)
Sam becomes a man (Episode 8, 52:15)
Black Walder closes the doors (Episode 9, 41:56)

Ask that same person to recount anything memorable which actually occurred in the first half an episode: we've basically got the trial which opens episode 5 and the awkward ceremony that occurs 15 minutes into episode 8.  The rest is oft-boring dialogue which does nothing to enhance the show's infrequent memorable moments.

Good episodic television is made up of acts which provide exposition, introduce new characters/plotlines, or advance existing plotlines.  Whatever its purpose, a good act of episodic television accomplishes its goal in a compelling manner.

Soap operas are made up of numerous characters involved in many storylines, each of which is advanced only a few minutes at a time with little-to-no relation to any of the other ongoing storylines.  They are trite, boring, manipulative, and formulaic.

Note to Benihoff and Weiss: Please stop producing a medieval soap opera and get back to the brilliant episodic television your series once was (also, it's OK for something interesting to happen in the first 40 minutes of an episode, and for a good episode to be placed in the first half of a season).

Unfortunately, the commentaries (my primary driver in purchasing the Blu-rays) are equally as dreadful and uninspired as the rest of this season.  Allow me to summarize all 12 for you:

"These opening credits are amazing - have you noticed how they change from week-to-week?"
"Jack Gleeson is so sweet, nothing at all like Joffrey.  Did you know he plans to quit acting to become a philosopher?"
"Oh, I just love (whoever is on screen at that moment) - he/she is brilliant."
"The sets are brilliant."
"The costumes are brilliant."
"This music is brilliant."
"These child actors are brilliant."
"David and Dan are brilliant."
"These scenes are just so brilliant I don't want to talk over them."
"Have you actually read the books?"
"Was this shot in Croatia or Ireland?"
"Did you know they painted the Titanic here?"
"Did I mention that Jack Gleeson wants to quit acting to become a philosopher?"

I'm not sure whether the show runners made a mistake by deciding to divide this book across 2 seasons of the show, but I am certain they are doing an absolutely dreadful job of it.  This Blu-ray set is comprised of 5 episodes worth of actual content excruciatingly (and completely unnecessarily) stretched across 10 installments, complemented by a host of weak and equally boring commentary tracks.  Episodes 8-10, along with sporadic scenes from 1-7, get 5 stars.  The remainder of episodes 1-7 get 2 stars, and the lackluster bonus features get 2 stars.  The net result is a 3 star rating, which feels generous given the massive head start provided by the source material.

Its just an incredible show, the Blu-ray is easily a 5 out of 5. I would however like to address the fact that the only difference between this Edition and the regular Blu-ray/DVD combo pack is the 'statue'. Which while cool is completely hollow, it serves as a large Blu-ray sleeve. As such most of the thing just sits on a pedestal with square pegs sitting in square slots, it is NOT a solid structure. While these are serviceable to hold the tombstone-esk piece on to the base, I have notice the solid dragon statue attached to the thing makes it droop forward when displayed without the Blu-ray box inside it, so be aware that it may fall forward of its base without the season (or an equally large Blu-ray set) inside it. So if you're like me and want to display the statue somewhere other than the the DVD season that's something to keep in mind. Other than that I love it, but depending on the price point your enjoyment of the total set may vary.  I do however highly recommend the show itself as reflected in my score, its just the display case you should maybe be dubious of.

Also just FYI the Dragon on display is Dracarys, his name is emblazoned on the back of the structure. Thought fans of the books/show might want to know.

Just finished up season 3 and highly enjoyed the episodes.  One major complaint I have with this series is that they feature Lena Headey & her evil son King Jofferey way too much, taking away screen time from the other characters.  The character of Tywin Lanister is explained more, especially his twisted relationship with his children including the Dwarf character who is one of the only good guys on this show. The exploits of the Dragon Queen Kolisie are excellent, and as far as I am concerned she is the only main character I really care about through out this entire series.

 What I would like from this series is a bit more action and combat, a little less ploting and drama.  Other very interesting characters such as the black Pirate are hardly featured, in favor of other plot movers.  The non heroic, but never the less other good guy (besides the Dwarf, and Kolisie) is the heavy set young man from the Knight's Watch who find's himself surviving in this violent and dark sadistic medieval world where brutality is the norm.  With many grey characters, this show is very original and a simular concept seems to have only been touched upon before with movies such as "Braveheart" with Mel Gibson, and the early 80's with "Excalibur".  My hat's off to the author of this series, for creating very detailed and original work.  In my mind this entire show is a fantasy depiction of the violent real history of medieval Europe, set in a "Dungeons & Dragons" background.

 What I would like to see is the plot, and characters move along at a faster pace.  Especially the Dragon Queen Kolisie.  It seems it takes forever for these characters to get anywhere.  Another issue I have is there are just way too many characters to follow.  The warfare regarding Kolisie's newly obtained army, and her dragons needs to be focused on.

 Films like the "300" series, which are equally fantastic, have way too much focus on the fighting, while this show is the complete opposite.  Over all this is light years ahead of the childish, "Lord of the Rings", and "Hobbit" series.  Can't wait for season 4.

In general, I've been really impressed with the quality and the extras of the Game of Thrones Blu-Ray series. I like having the multiple options for digital copies. I don't have much use for the extra DVD copies at present, but they take little space in the overall packaging.

With a story and a world as complex as this one, HBO uses Blu Ray to great effect with the in-episode guides which give information about the characters in the scene, where the scene is taking place. Extra historical videos are available contextually as well, giving information on past events, houses, and places. Sound and picture is superb, and the series continues to get more and more commentary and it's actually pretty good!

However, I had one problem: my copy showed up with two Disc 3 copies, and no Disc 2. While I have copies of the episodes on Disc 2 thanks to the digital copy (and HBO Go), I miss out on the extras. The DVDs may have the commentary, but I find the in-episode guide helpful and fascinating. Unfortunately, I waited too long to start my re-watch of season 3 and missed any deadline for returning the package to HBO. This does not seem to be a widespread issue, but it's frustrating to me. I like to have physical copies of my favorite HBO series so I can watch them in pristine quality at any time and enjoy the extras, and the packaging of the Game of Thrones series (and most HBO series) makes them good as keepable items. Not much good to keep a set of discs that's missing crucial episodes (which also damages future resale/trade-in value should I ever want it).

No doubt GoT is a great series - but the Blu Ray pack for Season 3 has a TON of Special Features and interactive pop-ups during the episodes.

The Rains of Castamere episode has a crazy commentary/feature where they play the entire episode in a small frame on the screen and there is a second frame with director commentary and behind the scenes footage.

Special Features and Commentaries are the only reasons I buy DVDs/Blu Ray and this has the most and best I've seen ever.  Great box set!

Game of Thrones Season 3 continues with the brilliant adaptation of George R.R. Martin's books.  This is one of televisions most impressive accomplishments to date.  The set designs, costuming, etc are absolutely brilliant.  The acting is superb.

I am simultaneously reading Martin's books and I will say that the Game of Thrones series does vary considerably in many respects to the books.  That is understandable.  The books are long and incredibly complex from just about every standpoint.  The books can, in fact, become quite tedious in an over-abundance of detail.  The series cuts off a lot of that fat and does make many substantial changes.

This review, however, is primarily about the Game of Thrones: Season 3 Blu-ray/DVD disc set.  As usual, I went on a Game of Thrones viewing binge as soon as I got my set delivered.  My experience with this disc set is that it has worked flawlessly and the quality of the video is first rate. The set contains 5 Blu-ray discs  containing ten episodes.  Disc #5 contains only the final episode of Season 3: "Mhysa".  Unlike some reviews I have read, I have had no playback issues whatsoever with my Sony Blu-ray player and it is a relatively inexpensive 2 1/2 year-old model.  I did not have to perform any updates or other nonsense that some reviewers talk about.  That may be because the Sony performs automatic updates; I don't really know.  Some reviewers have complained that they were unable to watch any of their older Blu-ray discs or DVDs after performing an update to their player.  Fortunately, I have had no such issues.  My player still plays any of the older DVDs and Blu-ray discs without any problems.

I am not going to further review the Game of Thrones Season 3 series itself other than to say that if you are averse to (1) nudity (2) "colorful" language (3) copious amounts of blood  (4)violence then you'd best stay away.  Far away.  Game of Thrones is set in a fantasy Middle Ages type world somewhat similar to but also vastly different from the world of Tolkien's "Lord of the Rings".  It is not nearly as "gentle" as Tolkien's great work, however.  Just a word of advice for anyone who has not yet seen Game of Thrones: don't get too deeply emotionally attached or invested in ANY character.  You'll be sorry you did. ; )

The Game of Throne: Season 3 Blu-ray disc set is another total winner.  Highly recommended to any Game of Thrones fan.

If one were to categorize and compare, say against the likes of the Lord of the Rings movie series, Gladiator, and Brave Heart. The Dexter TV series, Seinfeld, Star Trek, and even MASH TV series'. This is (in it's own right, and in the opinion of me, myself and I) the most captivating, mesmerizing, brutal, humbling, vulgar, ruthless, happiest, saddest, inspiring, and simply put, entertaining shows ever created. And it just keeps getting better with age, like a fine scotch whiskey. It will be a sad day when this series comes to a close. But for the time being I encourage anyone who has not yet indulged in this remarkable series to take a moment for themselves and become lost in an unforgettable game. The Game of Thrones.

While still unquestionably the best fantasy show in the history of television, this season saw both some soaring highs as well as a few dips. What has been great about the show from the start remains great, and some characters who've stumbled before get fantastic moments and development in this season.

However some cracks are showing in the armor of this show, and most of them are romantic. While love has played into aspects of the show before it's never been sappy. At least not before this season. There are multiple romantic pairings, and while some work better than others none of them really bring anything new or interesting to the table. In fact they feel like they diminish some of these complex characters by reducing them to the clich of "doing it all for love."

Despite the stumbles this is undoubtedly a game changing season, as events in the last two episodes completely reshape the future of the Westeros. In many ways this feels like a season that's largely about setting the stage for what is to come: making sure that the proper players are in place while removing those who don't really matter in the grand scheme. That makes it essential, though perhaps not quite as inherently enjoyable as the first two seasons.

The third season of "Game of Thrones" continues to provide depth and an ever intriguing storyline where the machinery of those seeking power and those in power continue to grind against each other.

George R. R. Martin's novel (his third) that forms the basis of the series benefits from a streamlined storyline and a slightly reduced group of characters in the TV version. While it isn't necessary to have read the novels it certainly is fascinating to contrast the way that they've elected to tell the same story in different mediums.

SPOILERS:

Tyrion (Peter Dinklage who continues to give a outstanding performance) recovers from helping to defend the city against the forces of Stannis Baratheon(Stephen Dillane) only to find that his father Tywin (Charles Dance) is seen as the savior of the city and made Hand of the King. Tyrion also discovers that his evil nephew King Joffrey tried to have him murdered on the battlefield.

Rob Stark (Richrad Madden) continues to win battles but struggle to keep his fragile alliance together which, ultimately, culminates in the infamous "black wedding" in the penultimate episode of the season.

Daenerys Targaryen (Emilia Clarke) continues to gather her own forces including buying a mercenary army as part of her plans to gradually take back her kingdom.

The rest of the Stark children are still on the run.

END OF SPOILERS:

The Blu-ray looks terrific with a nice, detailed transfer. Blacks are deep and rich while detail is rich throughout.

The audio remains outstanding as well with a very active lossless surround him. Subtitles are in English and Spanish.

The special features include 12 commentary (some episodes have more than one) tracks with a mix of behind-the-scenes creative folks as well as cast.

Featurettes include "A Gathering Storm", "New Characters" profile and a picture-in-picture piece for the episode  "The Rains of Castamere Unveiled" the most emotionally taxing episode of the series.

The deleted and extended scenes are worthwhile checking out as they include pieces that extend the characters but were, undoubtedly, cut for pacing and time.

"Inside the Wildlings" gives us a glimpse into the characters beyond the wall while "The Politics of Marriage" lives up to its title focusing on the various unions and why they are pursued.

There is also a set of DVDs included in a separate cardboard container. The set is handsomely packaged with a slipcase that features the image you see here of the dragon's shadow.

HBO has done an outstanding job of providing additional value for fans who watched the series on their network with their Blu-ray releases. Unlike Showtime which often releases some of their flagship series with little to nothing in the way of special features, HBO makes the Blu-ray worthwhile for fans to pick up and watch again.

I don't have HBO so I waited anxiously for Season 3 to finally be released on DVD. There is nothing like GAME OF THRONES on TV or in the theaters. In fact, GAME OF THRONES surpassing just about any theatrical movie for quality and visual effects. A TV version of GAME OF THRONES allows for deeper character and story details. Sadly, there are only 10 episodes in the Season 3 but they are 10 seriously powerly episodes. GAME OF THRONES is addictive and can't be missed. It is set in a mythical land that looks and feels like medieval Europe. The costumes and settings are lavish. It feels not expense was spared in the filming of this remarkable show. It is an actor and Casting Director's dream with parts for actors of all ages, sizes and looks.

 I could spend pages extolling the virtues of the cast of Season 3 but I feel there are two amazing standouts. Maisie Williams plays young Arya Stark trying to avenge her father's murder and reunite with her family. Dressed as a boy she exudes anger and determination in her face. We feel her anger and pain and determination. This fine young actress has a bright future. Another remarkable actor is Alfie Allen as Theon Greyjoy. This season he is a prisoner being tortured by a mysterious person. Allen is so believable in his pain and misery. We see it in his eyes and actions. Here is another actor to watch.
It is great to see lovely Diana Rigg as Olenna Tyrell. We rarely see this fine British actress and it's a joy to see her as the aging Tyrell Matriach in a role she obviously loves. Add in beloved character actor Charles Dance and the gorgeous Natalie Dormier and we have quite the cast and again, I could go on for pages just discussing the actors.

There is a "look" to GAME OF THRONES that deserves praise for the production team. The lavish locales are awesome. We are taken from dark and forbodding locations to lush and lovely settings. It's hard to imagine all the work involved in filming this series.

A word of caution. GAME OF THRONES is not for the squeamish. Season 3 brings us to new heights of gore and violence. This season maiming and loss of body parts are on the agenda. No one is safe and no one is spared as the innocent kill the innocent. It's war afterall we hear over and over.

GAME OF THRONES is am amazing show to delight the senses and unnerve the weak-hearted.

So...if you're a GOT (Game of Thrones) fan, there's nothing more I can add that hasn't already been said. However, I want to address the product/packaging itself.

Here's what I like:
Amazon is quick on delivery. As an Amazon Prime member, I received the product on the very day it was released. Outstanding!

HBO provides good value in the product in that it includes Blu-Ray, DVD, and a Ultraviolet (UV) copy within the package. For ease and convenience, I like being able to binge watch the program through my VUDU/Flixster/UV accounts without having to change discs every couple of episodes. For me, this is a great and I wish more companies would offer this value for the price.

Here's what I don't like:
O.k...I said I wouldn't review the product, and I'm not. However, I wish (for the cost), there were more episodes since there are only 10 per season. Of course, those 10 are very well done, but only last an hour. So...at regular price, you're basically paying nearly four bucks per episode. Ditto for other HBO shows like "Girls". And, VEEP has only eight episodes per season.

Superb acting, production, story, etc. etc.  To get somewhat picky, some of the actors mumble their lines, speak too quickly and/or the mike pickup is such that one cannot hear what they say regardless. This seems to be an increasing problem in movies and TV shows and you start to think maybe it's that your hearing is going.  But then you watch older shows and find good clarity.  So I believe it's just a matter of laziness on the part of some or perhaps the movie and TV directors let things go in order to meet deadlines. Also, keeping track of the various characters and their place in the "game" can easily become confusing but one only has to access the provided plot and character reviews for a good reminder of this.

while i am still on season 3, so i can not speak to season 4, i can say that this is the best season and that is saying something. this show is brilliant. i am getting distressed that i am almost thru season 3 and season 4 for me is a year away since i don't have HBO. they set out to make this season epic and they have done so. the ability to buy entire seasons and watch as i please has ruined me in a way. but it is so addicting. many new great characters and as usual some key ones killed off. as they say in the "making of" videos for every character killed off they add 2 more. they could make a series for several of the sub-stories in this show. so good!

I watched the first two seasons of Game of Thrones.  In this third season, the plot seemed to thin out significantly.  It also seemed to just not have as much content as the first two seasons (this could be my imagination though).  Overall, I still like the series and will purchase season 4 when it comes out - but hope that it will become a little better in that season.

Game of Thrones has easily become one of my favorite television programs, and this latest season released on blu-ray is truly something to behold. The production of this program seems to increase tenfold season to season as HBO attracts more viewers, so not only is the story itself engaging but it is a visual masterpiece for television.
I have read all of the books that have been published, so I can say as a fan of the novels that you ought not be skeptical of the visual format of "A Song of Ice and Fire". That being said, yes, the show does take a few liberties but what else can be expected when each book is a thousand pages or more in length. Some people argue that HBO has taken away some of the quality of the source material, but I find any changes acceptable.
The only reason I did not give this product five stars is because the inner packaging was torn upon arrival. Like the other blu-ray collections for this show, season three unfolds into one long cardboard piece. One of the segments was torn, so as a result I have to be very delicate with the box. Seeing how this season was just released when I purchased it I blame the damage on either the packaging amazon ships the blu-ray in, or perhaps how an amazon or postal employee handled the item.

Obviously, you'll want to start from season 1, but this is a really good show if you're not a total prude. It is HBO, so they swear, they kill each other, they get nekkid, and sometimes they have sex. There is nudity in this show, tastefully done, but it is there. One of the main characters runs a brothel- how do you show THAT without a little t and a?? All that aside, the acting is phenomenal, the writing is some of the best I've seen in a television drama (the acting and writing are better than I see in most movies). If you're looking for some good watching, and you don't need to have your kids along, and you don't consider the human body an object of shame designed by lucifer himself, you might actually enjoy this series a lot.

Daenerys Targaryen meets an unlikely supporter in Slaver's bay, Arya meets the Brotherhood without Banners, Catelyn finds out that her two youngest sons are "Dead" and Bran meets two companions, as they start North, Toward the Wall.

Meanwhile, Jon Snow finds love with the Fire-kissed Ygritte, and the Others find the Night's Watch.

I've viewed all three seasons of Game of Thrones strictly through the Blu-ray medium. The production values are superb, the story and characters enthralling, etc. No problem with the content itself.

However, I have down-rated this set based on its whole hearted embrace of the Blu-ray characteristic of the incredibly long (and seemingly growing) time it takes to load a disc and start viewing actual program content. On this set, besides the minutes-long blank screen (with an occasional "tree" icon), we are also forced to watch a couple meaningless clips from other series, and some ominous warnings such as ensuring the "language" setting on our player is correct.

If the Blu-ray designers and programmers were intending to hasten the end of physical media and push us all toward on-line viewing, then they are doing a fine job.

I've read the books and this is by far one the best series that tries to maintain integrity with the original book. I'm glad that Amazon offers it as instant streaming because I don't have HBO at this time. I highly recommend this series.
The show is amazing! Superb acting, intriguing plot line and fantastic characters. Each episode leaves me wanting more and more.

The product was everything that was promised, the discs are all in great condition and installing the digital copies was a simple task. What was really nice was the fact that when I returned home from work, there were my discs waiting for me. No need to remember to go got the store to pick it up on distribution day. Managed to get it at a cheaper price than the stores I used to go to, yep you read that right, used to go to. All in all, great buy!!

A somewhat slow start to the season  also leads one to believe that the nudity and violence have been intentionally cut from the show. Things pick up a few episodes in, as does the nudity,erotica and graphic portrayal of violence. A few scenes late in the season are actually cringe-worthy. However,- overall the nudity, sex and violence are (as usual for the series) integral to flushing out this world, it's inhabitants and the story itself. It seems the screen plays are more nuanced then in past seasons when dealing w/ mature subject matters; in a graphic visual sense. The plot lines twist and turn (to the worst) for many characters, and almost no one is safe from Bad happenings. Really Bad. I love this series.  I read the books and the HBO series is excellent.  This is the best season so far.  My disappointment is with the Blu-ray discs themselves.  There must be a serious manufacturing problem.  The first set I got, one of the discs would not load. I returned it and the replacement they sent me had the same problem with a differnt disc.  I updated my player firmware, but that did not help.  I had amazon send me a third replacement, but I did not send the second set back.  I was hoping that between the two sets, I could compile a complete set of working discs.  The third replacement set had 2 bad discs, one of them the same as the second set.  So that is 3 bad sets that I received.  I decided to go buy another box set from my local Costco, and one of those discs was bad as well!!! So with 3 different box sets in my possession at the same time, I was FINALLY able to pull out the working discs to create a complete working set.  It took 4 box sets in all to get a working product.
So my advice if you want this: check all discs when you receive it.  If they don't work, ask for a replacement, but choose to return by dropping off at a UPS store.  Amazon gives you 30 days to drop it off.  Get as many sets as you need to compile 5 working discs.
The manufacturing problems are unacceptable.  I thought maybe only Amazon got a bad batch from the manufacturer, but it looks like they may all be defective anywhere you buy them.  I am happy to have a working product now, but the customer should not have to go through this process to get it.

I have read all of George Martin's books, and this series takes great liberties with the story.  I think half the stuff in the TV series is made up, using the same characters but creating dialogue and scenes that were not in the books.  That said, they do a pretty good job of lengthening the whole series through these creative additions.  I really like the dwarf (Tyrion) in this series (especially now with his scar on the cheek).  Jeffrey, the King, is still a total jerk, and many of the scenes that create out of nothing do a good job of making you dislike the boy king even more.  One thing about the series is they do skip around from section to section a lot, so you have to pay attention or you won't have a clue what is happening. (If you haven't read the books, you have no clue what is going to happen down the road to people like Jon Snow,Jeffrey,Sansa, etc.  What a delightful series!!!

The wings of the dragon are SO beautiful and surprisingly sturdier than I expected! (Although do NOT put pressure on them in case of accidental damage.) The actual DVD box fits inside the tomb, so be very careful when taking your box in and out of the tomb casing - as the top does not connect to the base as well as you'd think! Nonetheless, that doesn't bother me at all and I am in love!
All in all, it was a great buy and definitely worth the money! Fast shipping, no problems at all, and a great collectors item which doubles as a show piece suitable for any GoT fans!

I had been waiting (none too patiently) for this season to finally come out and I was not disappointed.  The problem is, if you only see the show on blu-ray and then gobble them up in just a few nights because you can't not just turn to the next episode, not only do you lose sleep, but you get so wrapped up in the world of Game of Thrones that its hard to come back down.  As ever, this show is full of sex and beauty, horror and honor, grace and violence.  The special effects are very good--especially love the dragons--and its so compelling that you can't not watch it, even the bits that have you wincing or wishing you had covered your eyes.

This season is full of surprises, most of them not so good for our well-loved characters.  That's one thing about this show...you never know if someone will be there tomorrow or not.  And, all the while, we see the progress being made by Daenerys as she comes into her own, as much as her dragons, and continues on her quest to go back to Westeros and take back the Iron Throne.  She is so lovely and so inspiring and I hope hope hope that when she finally engages in the Game of Thrones with all of the rest of the would-be Kings and Queens that the show really pulls off what they are hinting at.

Some spoilers below:

As said above, one of my favorite story lines revolves around Daenerys.  I love it when she surprises her own supporters and keeps on growing in wisdom and strength.  Her resolve not to undermine what she believes in in the process of raising her army is precisely what will make her a great Queen, as well as her will to punish those who enslave others.  You go, girl!

I am also shockingly fascinated by the growing relationship between Jaime and his female-knight-protector, and how much I have grown to not necessarily forgive Jaime for his past actions, but to understand where they come from.  Just as with Cersei and Tyrion...the author of their bad behavior firmly lies with their father.  But, on the other hand, their father is not a flat boring bad guy per se, as he is acting only out of what he sees as necessary to protect his family and his family's name.  The Lannisters are definitely a family you can love to hate.  Though, of course, out of all of them, I do adore their blacksheep, Tyrion, who has a heart of melting gold that he tries and fails to hide and protect.

The storyline with Jon Snow continues to build as he is forced to consider what he truly believes in, and who he believes in.  I very much see him being a mover and shaker in future stories as the White Walkers and other creatures begin to trek southwards as Winter comes.  The climb up the Wall in this season was truly frightening.

As for the Starks...OMG...well, 'nuff said.  Things have definitely been going from bad to worse to impossible for this poor family.  Though, I am enjoying the shamanistic aspect of the three-eyed raven dreams and the introduction of being able to look through the eyes of animals and control them...I am still left wondering how this will play into the next season.  What can one crippled boy and his friends do in the face of the White Walkers?  I suppose we will find out...

As for the rest...conspiracy, darkness disguised as light and light as darkness, hardship, loss, grief, anger, religious fanaticism...this show stalks them all.  The only thing I felt went on for too long was the whole torture stuff with Theon (not one of my favorite characters)--blechy!  It just seemed too much a bit pointless, but who knows?  This show has pulled many rabbits out of many hats before.

Once again--an absolute MASSIVE HIT of a show!  Now, I have to start the long wait for Season 4 to come out...bummer.

5 stars is not really enough for me, this is a masterwork and it is rare to see stuff this good in the age of low budget reality TV drivel. This is an epic done with more than adequate resources in both actors and production.

Yet I must say that I still worry that this project is too ambitious especially given that Martin still hasn't finished his books and he's getting up there in age. I'd much rather finish reading the novels and put to rest a series that has been in the works for about two decades.

This season was crazy, but that goes without saying on the last two seasons of GoT anyway, right?  Problems are started to get bigger now...and at the end of Season 3, you get the feeling that something grand will be upon Westeros in a ridiculous way.

If you aren't on board yet, you need to give this a try, but you MUST start from Season 1.  Reading the books is not necessary, but if you have trouble keeping track of characters, you might want to do that first.

I am a big fan of sci-fi like Star trek Next Generation; Battlestar Gallactica; Firefly; and Vikings (you could argue VIkings isn't sci-fi, but it's close to medieval sci-fi)  Anyone who enjoys those items should definitely give this a try.

My ONLY complaint with this season, is that it ended without any cliffhangers.  You pretty much know exactly how Season 4 is going to start.  The 2nd to last episode really felt like a typical series finale, but I digress.  I'm not against how it ended, I just find it a bit different is all.

But without getting into spoilers...let's talk about what you get.

-Packaging- The bluray copies come in a map style folding format with striking photos of the main characters.  I'm not a huge fan of folding maps, as I never know how to do that...but luckily this is much less complicated.  The DVD copies come in a small and relatively plain sleeve...that is nudged inside the main cover.  I'm just glad that the DVD copies exist...it's a nice option for someone who wants to watch them at a friends house..but you know they don't have a bluray player.  Or perhaps your 2nd TV or whatever doesn't have one.

-Audio/Visual quality:  I can't compare this to the HBO streamed version, because I don't have HBO.  I played this on my ps4 and full 5.1 surround sound.  The audio is, as expected, fantastic.  Whether it's the sweeping music, fantastic actors/actresses, the sounds really bring you into the environment.  This series takes you far north of the wall, all over Westeros, and of course east to Qarth.  Each environment is unique and given much care.

-Extra features: Tons.  And I really enjoyed the "Histories and Lore" of of GoT on disc 5.  This was well made and well narrated.  The addition of narrations should make this have a bit of re playability as well.

It is almost impossible to write a review that does not give too much away, but I will be as general as possible with the description so as not to give away major spoilers.

The series of course is based on the series of books by George R.R. Martin.  If you have not read the books or seen the prior two seasons you cannot really jump into season three because there is just too much going on to pick it up in the middle. There are a lot of characters and story lines that jump back and forth, so you really do have to pay attention to figure out who is who and what side everyone is on.  Each season is essentially a mini-series that follows the events of one book. It is spread out throughout 10 episodes and the story keeps building upon itself.

If you are new to the series or looking at this because you have heard of it and are wondering what it is all about, you need to know that the show is very violent and has a lot of sexual content.  So if that is the kind of thing you do not want to watch then this is not the show for you.  It is set in a medieval fantasy world and involves a war to rule a kingdom.  While there are some truly evil characters, most have some shades of gray to them so they are not really all good or all bad.  And this is definitely a story where no character, no matter how central to the story is safe.

This season sees Daenerys Targaryen amassing an army to try to take back the throne, and on the surface it looks like she is the best equipped to do so.  Tywin Lannister; fresh off saving the day at the end of last season begins to show how much power he really has and while this means Tyrion, the only "good" member of the family is brought to heel somewhat, you do get see Joffrey put in his place to some extent.  The threat of the White Walkers continues, but we only continue to see them sporadically at this point just as has been the case in the first two seasons.  The Wildlings who Jon Snow encountered at the end of last season also have a much larger role in the third season.  In all there are about 5 ongoing story lines including those of Arya, Bran and Jamie Lannister.  I think they did a good job given all the stories as close to equal time as possible, even though some episodes gave more weight to one or two from time to time.

The high point of the season, not only in terms of the shocking nature of it but what it does to set the stage going forward is the "red wedding."  It is so pivotal to the series that there is about an hour long bonus feature devoted solely to that episode that contrasts it with how it played out in the book, and really broke down how they made it work for the show.  As for the other bonus materials for those who do get the discs, there is about 2 hrs of bonus features from making of and behind the scenes features, as well as deleted scenes and an interactive history of all the various regions in the Game Of Thrones world.  Definitely a lot of material for those who like to go through the bonus features.  Of course the show looks and sounds great on blu ray, and you will get the show on DVD as well.

Most likely you will have some idea if you are looking at this page about what the show is.  If you are a diehard fan and have seen the other seasons, this offers much of the same.  If you are curious as to what it is about, subject to the provisos I stated above about the nature of the series, if you are a fan of the fantasy genre, it is definitely worth checking out.

It's not only the complete immersion that Martin offers in lessons of English medieval history and there fore human character under stress that stood out from the regular fare of television. It is also his refusal to "moralize," to inject the episodes with a patronizing filter whereby "the good guy wins," or "the bad guy gets it," that gave the episodes such force for me. With Benioff and Weiss' effective transference from the novel to screenplay form, each character arc is shown through the prism of their needs,  their utterly human selves, as opposed to an author playing "god" and warping what a character might do in an idealized setting, "here's the last scrap of bread, Jim, here, you take it- you got a wife and kids.." Because of that and a powerful interweaving of fantasy supported by  a keen eye for emotional truth, the series kept me wanting more.

Such a great season of GoT! This DVD box set was shipped even quicker than I had expected...can't wait for season 4!
I liked season 1 the best so far. Thought season 3 was heavy on violence and thin on substance, scenes are broken up too much. The flow of the scenes is more and more predictable as they go on.
How about learning to tell a story without killing everything in sight. Pretty lousy. Just blood and guts porn. Wish I could un-watch it.

This season is done very well with some unexpected twists. can hardly wait for season 4 . Totally worth the price the characters are very believable . I glutted out and saw all 10 episodes in a week. What a world they have created!
